duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide guests with exceptional customer service by being the subject matter expert on all pet products, nutrition, services, and local community events related to animal care and wellness.
Engage with customers to determine their needs, provide product knowledge, and suggest appropriate merchandise and services to satisfy them.
Perform all aspects of point-of-sale service, including cash sales, credit and check sales, returns and exchanges.
Express passion about animal welfare and maintain integrity in the work area. Remain familiar with all new pet products and services to engage customers effectively.

Polite and professional response to inquiries regarding products, services, and pricing via telephone. Promote a positive culture of teamwork and inclusion, and inform Guests of upcoming adoption events.
Connect the customer with the right partner to deliver the guest experience and desired services. Maintain familiarity with current promotions and special services.
Complete other duties and special projects as assigned. Evaluate guest inquiries and refer to the Leader on Duty as needed.
Utilize selling behaviors and contribute to a safe environment in Pet Care Locations. Be a part of a collaborative culture and engage in career development programs.
Handle merchandise stocking and customer carry-outs, which may require bending, kneeling, lifting (up to 50 pounds), and standing for long periods of time.

education_certification.credential: High school diploma or GED. Certification in pet nutrition, PIJAC (California only), and familiarity with pet grooming, dog training, and pet services.
